intro: Parnassia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate parnassia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its white, bell-shaped flowers with a distinctive yellowish-green center. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it has a fibrous root system. Parnassia intermedia is often found in calcareous soils and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
